speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: Good afternoon, everyone. Thank you for being here.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: Over the past 24 hours, the president has continued to improve. He’s met or exceeded all standard hospital discharge criteria. He’ll receive another dose of remdesivir here today, and then we plan to get him home. It’s been more than 72 hours since his last fever, oxygen levels, including ambulatory saturations and his work of breathing are all normal. Though he may not entirely be out of the woods yet, the team and I agree that all our evaluations, and most importantly his clinical status, support the president’s safe return home, where he’ll be surrounded by world-class medical care 24/7.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: I’d like to bring Dr. Dooley up to review some more specifics.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Dooley
transcription: Good afternoon, just a brief update this morning. As Dr. Conley mentioned, the president continues to do very well. His vital signs this morning were notable for a temperature of 98.1, his blood pressure was 134 over 78, and a respiratory rate of 17 respirations per minute, and his heart rate was 68 beats per minute. His last oxyhemoglobin saturation was 97% on room air. He currently does not endorse any respiratory complaints, and aside from our evaluation with the multi-disciplinary team this morning, has maintained a full schedule, ambulating and working on the White House medical unit.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Dooley
transcription: I’ll now turn it over to Dr. Garibaldi to again discuss therapeutics. Thanks.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Brian Garibaldi
transcription: Hi, good afternoon. Again, I just wanted to echo the sentiment of what an honor it is to be part of this wonderful team here at Walter Reed. Yesterday evening the president received his third dose of remdesivir and he tolerated that infusion without difficulty and his kidney and liver function continued to be normal. Our plan is to give the fourth dose of remdesivir this evening before he goes back to the White House. We’ve made arrangements to deliver the fifth and final dose of his treatment course at the White House tomorrow evening. He continues on dexamethasone and, again, the plan for today is to continue to be up and out of bed, eat and drink, and work as he is able.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Brian Garibaldi
transcription: I’d like to turn it over to Dr. Jason Blaylock, who’s an infectious disease specialist and the chief of medicine here at Walter Reed to give some updates on infection control. Thank you.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Jason Blaylock
transcription: Good afternoon, everyone. First of all, I just want to say what an honor it’s been to be part of this medical team behind me and to care for the president.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Jason Blaylock
transcription: Since the president’s arrival at Walter Reed, he’s received medical management that remains in line with national, clinical, societal guidelines for treatment of COVID-19 infection. In addition, both myself and Dr. Wes Campbell have worked very closely with various laboratories in the area, state-of-the-art facilities, to include USAMRAA and [RAR 00:03:10] on obtaining advanced diagnostic testing to really inform the White House medical team of both the status of the president, as well as his ability to transmit virus to others. Also, we have worked very closely with the Walter Reed team to ensure that we are looking very closely at infection control prevention strategies and the right posture so that the president can safely return to his residence.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Jason Blaylock
transcription: With that, I’m going to turn it over to Dr. Conley, who will answer any final questions?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: Thanks, Jason.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: I mentioned it Saturday, but I’d like to reiterate myself just how grateful the president and I are to the men and women of Walter Reed, our colleagues at Johns Hopkins, as well as the many federal, private institutions that we’ve received support from. So long as everything continues on the track that we’re experiencing right now, at this time, as the president already tweeted out, is to get him home later today. With that, I’ll take a couple questions.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 5
transcription: Dr. Conley, how can the president be discharged back to the White House when he was given steroids. You’ve said that he’s still on those steroids. Those are medicines, as you know, that are usually given to COVID patients who are on ventilators or with low oxygen, so did you over-treat him? If he’s still on that medication, how is it safe for him to return to the White House?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: We send patients home with medications all the time. In fact, yesterday afternoon, he probably met most of his discharge requirements safely from the hospital. He’s returning to a facility, the White House medical unit, that’s staffed 24/7, top-notch physicians, nurses, PAs, logisticians. The unit here, the team here behind me, is going to continue to support us in that nature.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: Yes?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 6
transcription: Dr. Conley. Dr. Conley, what are infection control measures are you taking and how was it safe for him to drive around in a cloth mask yesterday? How is it safe for him now to return to the White House where there’ve been so many cases? How’s any of this safe?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: The president has been surrounded by medical and security staff for days wearing full PPE. Yesterday, the US Secret Service agents were in that same level of PPE for a very short period of time. We’ve worked with our infectious disease experts to make some recommendations for how to keep everything safe down at the White House for the president and those around him. We’re looking at where he’s going to be able to carry out his duties, office space. I’ll just say that it’s in line with everything we’ve been doing upstairs for the last several days.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 7
transcription: Can you tell us please, on testing, can you tell us when he had his last negative test? Was it Thursday? Was it Wednesday? Do you remember when he had his last negative test?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: I don’t want to go backwards.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 7
transcription: It helps for contact tracing for people who were around him to know when he was positive.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: I understand. The contact tracing, as I understand it, is being done. I’m not involved in that.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 8
transcription: [crosstalk 00:06:19] that he leave or was this something he pushed for?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: No. We try to get patients home and out of the hospital as quickly as is safe and reasonable. Every day a patient stays in the hospital unnecessarily is a risk to themselves. Right now there’s nothing that’s being done upstairs here that we can’t safely conduct down home.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 9
transcription: You had said that seven to ten days was a window that you’d be concerned about. I don’t think we’re there yet. Do you have concerns about potential worsening or reversal? What are your plans for addressing that if it were to happen?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: You’re absolutely right. That’s why we all remain cautiously optimistic and on guard because we’re in a bit of unchartered territory when it comes to a patient that received the therapies he has so early in the course. We’re looking to this weekend. If we can get through to Monday with him remaining the same or improving, better yet, then we will all take that final deep sigh of relief. But as I said, 24/7 world-class medical care surrounding him down there. We’re not going to miss anything that we would have caught up here.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 10
transcription: Where is he physically going to be in the White House? What does that look like? How do you keep him safely quarantined?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: I wish I could go into that more, but I just can’t.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 6
transcription: Doctor, why did you begin dexamethasone treatment?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: Yesterday, we talked about that, the several little temporary drops in his oxygen, and we had discussed that as a team and elected to start it early in case that persisted or worsened. The potential risks and side effects, we all discussed. We looked at the data and decided that we’d rather, push ahead on it then hold and risk the opposite.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 6
transcription: What about CT scans and X-rays? What have you seen on his chest X-rays?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 11
transcription: [crosstalk 00:08:18] resume his campaigning?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: As far as travel goes, we’ll see.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 12
transcription: Dr. Conley, on his mental status, can you talk about whether he has any neurological symptoms? Does he have any side effects from his medications, any fogginess from the virus?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: No. I think you’ve seen the videos and now the tweets and you’ll see him shortly. He’s back. Yeah.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 6
transcription: What about his chest X-rays and CT scans?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 13
transcription: Have you seen any evidence of pneumonia or any inflammation in his lungs at all?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: We’ve done routine standard imaging, I’m just not at liberty to discuss.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 6
transcription: Doctor you were on board Air Force One.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 14
transcription: You’re actively not telling us what those lung scans showed, just to be clear.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: There are HIPAA rules and regulations that restrict me in sharing certain things for his safety and his own health and reasons.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 15
transcription: You said his oxygen dropped several times. Can you share how many times he was on oxygen? You said you would check with the nursing staff yesterday.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: Yeah. Yeah. Yes. Yes. Two episodes, like we talked about yesterday, and both times that he received a little bit of oxygen and recovered immediately.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 15
transcription: Was it required? Was that oxygen required?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: No, it wasn’t required. He wasn’t short of breath. He wasn’t looking ill. It was more of us trying to anticipate needs and see how he’d respond. In both cases, he came right off. He didn’t need it for very long at all.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 6
transcription: Doctor, you were on board Air Force One for multiple trips, are you at all concerned about your own exposure and exposure to the medical team?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: I am concerned, but as the CDC says, there are caveats for essential employees that as long as you continue to test negative, you remain symptom-free and you keep a mask on when you’re out and about, which we do inside the hospital, 24/7, then you can carry on your duties.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: Yeah?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 10
transcription: We all know the president’s an impatient man, has he been itching to get out of here?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: The president has been a phenomenal patient during his stay here. He’s been working hand in glove with us and the team. Today it got to the point, he’s holding court with those of us around him, the whole team, going over all the specifics, the testing, what the future is, and we have been back and forth on what’s safe, what’s reasonable. He has never once pushed us to do anything that was beyond a safe and reasonable practice that we all first wanted.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 16
transcription: Was there anybody on this medical team, who recommended against the president leaving here and going back to the White House today?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 16
transcription: Or any White House staffers?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: No.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 6
transcription: The president said, “Don’t be afraid of COVID.” Do you agree with that? Should we not be afraid?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: I’m not going to get into what the president says.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 17
transcription: You said his heart, liver, and kidney function was normal or improving. Improving, does that mean that there were effects and is it all normal? What’s up with that?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: Yeah. It’s all normal right now. I would say he appeared to be a little dehydrated Friday. He was able to just drink and recover from that. Yeah, everything looks great.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 18
transcription: Doctor, what would you like to see before he starts, resumes campaigning out in the country? What sort of things do you want to see?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: Yeah. The big first thing that we need to do is that there is no evidence of live virus still present that he could possibly transmit to others, and that’s what the infectious disease experts and some of our partners, military, civilian entities doing some of these advanced diagnostics just to see, as soon as we can identify that routinely. We talk about a 10-day window, CDC guidelines, but we’re checking him more routinely than just waiting 10 days. There’s a possibility it’s earlier than that. There’s a chance that it’s a little bit later, but we will know as soon as possible. Then we will look at him clinically. How are you feeling? How are you doing?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 19
transcription: Why have you decided not to use, administer hydroxychloroquine to the president during his time here?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: I’m not going to go into all of our debates about specific medicines and therapies. There are dozens of therapies that we were made aware of that we considered, that we discussed and debated and looked at the existing literature on. This is the regimen we chose.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 19
transcription: [crosstalk 00:12:44] hydroxychloroquine.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: Yeah?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 20
transcription: On the symptoms of COVID, is he’s having some of the muscle aches? Has he lost his sense of taste and smell?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: No. We were just talking about that, what symptoms he has left. Even the slight cough that he used to have, he doesn’t really complain of at all. He hasn’t ever complained of a muscle aches. Yeah, he’s up and back to him old self, predominantly.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 10
transcription: You talked about next Monday, just to be clear, how long will he still be actively shedding the virus?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: This morning, I believe there was even an accounting by Dr. Fauci referencing a five day, the first five days of illness that people are most likely to shed live virus. There’s a reason there’s the 10 days. It’s because most people, by that time, after seven days, most folks don’t have culturable live virus. They put it to 10, just to give some extra space. It’s never 100% between everybody, so we’ll see. I’m not going to put a specific number, but we look at that window is all I will say.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 21
transcription: Doctor, will the president be confined to his residence or will he be allowed to return to the Oval Office?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: We’re going to do whatever it takes for the president to safely conduct business, whatever it is he needs to do within the residence and White House.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 22
transcription: Is he on blood thinners? Also, has he been using, have you been giving him Tylenol, Advil, anything to bring his fever down?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: Oh, that came up. I would like to say, he has not been on any fever-reducing medications for over 72 hours.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 22
transcription: But what about the blood thinners?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: Yeah. He’s on a routine regimen of COVID therapy. I’m not going to go into specifics as to what he is and is not on, but …
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 23
transcription: You said, I’m going to read this here, that the president had a mild cough, some nasal congestion and fatigue on Thursday. Now back to my colleague, John Jacobs question, the reason knowing when the president’s last negative test is important for that reason, your words, what you said, and also for the contract tracing, but would you’ve recommended that given those symptoms that he go, that the president go to that Bedminster fundraiser?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: It’s not up to me, necessarily, the president’s schedule, but I would say that it wasn’t until after he returned that we really sat down, then knowing the news of the day that we really dove into, how are you feeling? What’s going on?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 23
transcription: But how was that safe given that those were the symptoms he was experiencing on Thursday?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: I’m not going to get into operations.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 6
transcription: Doctor, one last time, when was his last negative test and what was his viral load?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: I know everyone wants that.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 6
transcription: We’ve been exposed. [crosstalk 00:15:24]
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: Yeah. I I don’t have his viral load. Those are some of the diagnostics that we’re sending out that will really tell us when it’s safe for him to get back out and around people.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 6
transcription: You’ve never had his viral load?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 24
transcription: Why is it [crosstalk 00:15:37] say when the last negative test was?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 25
transcription: Did he have any abnormal tests? Were any of his lab tests abnormal?
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: Again, HIPAA kind of precludes me from going into too much depth on things that I’m not at liberty or he doesn’t wish to be discussed. At some future point, maybe. But today, I’m sorry. I think that’s it. Yeah.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 26
transcription: Thank you, guys, so much.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Dr. Sean Conley
transcription: Thank you.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5

speaker: Speaker 26
transcription: Thank you.
headlin: Donald Trump’s Medical Team Press Conference Transcript from Walter Reed on Trump’s Condition October 5
